reviews.review_msg: Leith loves her students and is extremely passionate about teaching. Her lectures are informative and interesting, and the seminars were equally engaging. She gives excellent feedback and is the sweetest professor you will ever have.

The four hour class on 18th Century Literature consisted of short quizzes and writing assignments that had nothing to do with the readings.  Her "mini-lectures" of authors and writings might very well be from wikipedia and she is not open to discussion but prefers to have students echo her own beliefs. Waste. Of. Time.
IF you take her 320 course be warned that most of her focus is on poetry and women poets. If you dislike poetry as much as I do, do not take this course with her.
She's very organized and knows how to teach well. She reminds me of a younger version of my grandma. She's very sweet and understanding.

many little assignments. we made a class wiki page, which was a horror. far too much group work, which wasn't so much work as it was group. much too much time spent on democratically choosing the class's proceedings. Not enough learning. But, that said, she is very interested in her work. that makes the class bearable, sort of.
